title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page is about the analysis on the relationship between life expectancy and population
As shown in the graph below, it is clear that the life expectancy is higher for a country as population is higher

# Install packages
# !pip install pandas gapminder

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)


gapminder_df

1704 rows × 6 columns




data_2007 = gapminder

# Create scatter plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
for country in data_2007["country"].unique():
    subset = data_2007[data_2007["country"] == country]
    plt.scatter(subset["population_millions"], subset["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.7)

plt.xscale("log")  # Log scale for better visualization
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs. Population (2007)")
plt.xlabel("Population (log scale)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.grid(True, which="both", linestyle="--", linewidth=0.5)
plt.show()

title: Gapminder Data Analysis
text:
The dataset that is used for this quiz is gapminder.csv and it contains 6 columns and 1,704 rows. The columns are: country, continent, year, life_expectancy, population_millions, and gdp_per_capita. The dataset contains information about these variables in 142 countries over the years 1952 to 2007, with a 5-year interval.

About - Learn more about the dataset.
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita - Analysis of the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita.
Life Expectancy and Population - Analysis of the relationship between life expectancy and population.
Country Analysis - Trends in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a selected country.
Contact - Get in touch for questions or feedback.

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page analyzes changes in Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population over time for a selected country from the Gapminder dataset. The graph below visualizes these trends. It is clear that all 3 elements show increasing trend overall.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)


gapminder_df

1704 rows × 6 columns




country_data = gapminder[gapminder["country"] == 'India']

fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
ax1.plot(country_data["year"], country_data["life_expectancy"], marker="o", color="blue", label="Life Expectancy")
ax1.set_ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)", color="blue")
ax1.set_xlabel("Year")
ax2 = ax1.twinx()
ax2.plot(country_data["year"], country_data["gdp_per_capita"], marker="s", color="green", label="GDP per Capita")
ax2.set_ylabel("GDP per Capita", color="green")

ax3 = ax1.twinx()
ax3.spines.right.set_position(("outward", 60))  
ax3.plot(country_data["year"], country_data["population_millions"], marker="^", color="red", label="Population (scaled)")
ax3.set_ylabel("Population (millions)", color="red")
ax3.set_yticks([])

plt.title(f"Trends in Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population for India")
ax1.legend(loc="upper left")
ax2.legend(loc="upper right")
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page is about the analysis on the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita
According to the graph below, it is clear that the higher the GDP per capita is, the longer the life expectancy is

# Install packages
# !pip install pandas gapminder

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)


gapminder_df

data_2007 = gapminder[gapminder['year'] == 2007]

# Create scatter plot of Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(data=data_2007, x="gdp_per_capita", y="life_expectancy",  alpha=0.7)
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita (2007)")
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.grid(True, which="both", linestyle="--", linewidth=0.5)
plt.show()
